result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.dispoDesc:
*Dismissed with Prejudice 
*Reason:  Defendant has complied with all requirements of the DPA

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kayla Mae Hopp

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kayla Mae Hopp in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement. 
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: Count 2: No Contest

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty Count 2.  Clerk directed to with hold entry of Judgment of Conviction this date and enter DPA agreement. Count 1 is dismissed and read in.
Victim notification has been complied with and Victim is not present today.
ADA Constable states reasons for DPA recommendation. 
Atty makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:**DPA - Justice Works**
DPA agreement w/conditions stated in the agreement.
If successfully completes, matter would be expunged.
Plea hearing on October 7, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Prior: 1200 Riverview Ave 82, Stevens Point, WI 54481
